reviewText: Its a little bit random - and that works for me. I really do enjoy a game that feels a little different each time you play, and this game does give me that feeling. What you're getting in this game is a visit from the retro arcade shoot em' ups from yore... then mixed with a little dash of weird". :P\n\nGameplay wise
date: its Galaxian with a jumping ability. This jump allows you to dodge enemies at the bottom of the screen as well as dive out the way of all the incoming ships/aliens/bullet/meteors/tetrominoes and anything else that attacks/falls from the sky. Power ups are plentiful
recommended: each with a rapid/power mode. Collect crackers to extend the power-ups lifetime as well as rack up points to unlock more in-game oddities... basketballs
hoursPlayed:
anyone?

Visuals and sound are equally as pleasing and overall comes off as anything but bland. Definetly not one for people who want realism - which I appreciate. The presentation and humor are also a welcome gift.

So

reviewText:
I love a good shootem'up, and this is one of the better pick up and play shmups on Steam. I love how you don't even have to press the fire button. The game auto fires for you. All you have to do is move and jump. The devs clearly knew what they were doing, because in any normal shmup, there's never a reason to take your thumb off the fire button.

Lottsa power ups, random events like falling exploding basketballs, delightfully retro sound effects, and a good sense of progression through collecting crackers that unlock new stuff that shows up in the game. And while the sense of humor isn't particularly smart, it does the job of taking me back to the days of playing stupid Nickelodian flash games on their website.

The only part of this game that is reminiscent of Galaga is the enemy formations. That's about it. For the asking price, I'd say this is well worth it for a relaxing good time.
voteText: 9 of 9 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Great arcadey shooter title.

It is a mix of galaga/galaxian with a platforming twist.
There is a variety of weapon upgrades and enemy types.
It is fairly repetitive but addictive as a good shump should be.

The game follow an alien and his backpack laser as they kill aliens.
I am unsure why they are killing aliens, but as in all games aliens are better dead then alive. It has some simple progression as you unlock achievements, items and new enemy types as you continue to play.

Difficulty is quite low but still you will die over and over as that is the basis of these games they offer quick pick up and play enjoyment. If danmaku shmups are getting you down and want some old school with a twist this is a very good game for you as in it is a casual shooter with a more complex background.

I would highly recommend this game at a $4 price tag, i can see me dropping quite a few hours into it  either as a pick up and play for a few mins at a time title. Also for addicting hour + long session stress releif.

My props go out to the devs for making it engaging for all ages and audiences.

reviewText:
As a fan of James Kochalka's comics and records, I had to get this and I am glad it turned out to be be pretty good.

Glorkian Warrior is Space Invaders style shooter with autofire and a jump button. Instead of fixed levels, the games randomizes the successive waves of aliens as well as various other elements such as the ground you stand on or side challenges handed over by a pair of bossy sisters.

Enemies drop power-ups as expected and they are sorely needed as your default laser is slow and weak. The rare moments when you're stuck with your default with no upgrades in sight feel a bit underwhelming.

The game controls fine though the jumping lacks a bit in response and precision, IMO. My only gripe is that using a 360 controller the d-pad is set to jump and left/right movement, which would be fine except for the 360 pad being so imprecise, so you must use the left or right analogue stick to move.

It takes about 30 minutes of gameplay to unlock enough rewards to have the game really pick up the pace. Stick with it for a while if the first couple of minutes feel a bit slow and light on thrills.

So power up with pizza, fire up your Flarf Gun and don't pet the Astro Kitties!

reviewText:
Based on a graphic novel: The game is based upon James Kolchaka‚Äôs graphic novel ‚ÄòThe Glorkian Warrior Delivers a Pizza.‚Äô Kolchaka is the first resident of Vermont, a state in the New England region of the United States, to win the Laureate for best cartoonist. He is a prolific artist in the world of comics having written and illustrated for MARVEL with his ‚ÄòHulk Vs. The Rain‚Äò short that was originally published in black and white in an unauthorized alternative magazine, he is the creator of ‚ÄòMonkey Vs. Robot‚Äô and ‚ÄòImpy and Wormer‚Äô which was featured in Nickelodeon Magazine. In 2012 he won the Eisner Award for Dragon Puncher 2: Dragon Puncher Island. Kolchaka is a very talented man with his talents spreading across multiple forms of the entertainment industry. He is also a rock musician fronting his own band, James Kolchaka Superstar, who have released nine albums. His artistry in the game is outstanding ‚Äì everything looks precisely the way that you would want it to and is very easy on the eyes. It adds a tremendous amount of character to the game. It‚Äôs some of the best art work that I‚Äôve seen in this genre of indie gaming.

Challenging play: Glorkian Warrior offers some of the most challenging game play that I‚Äôve come across in some time. The mixture of Galaga-style shoot-em-up with platformer style gameplay works marvelously well. Deaths and hits generally always feel fair to me which is of vital importance. However,  I do take issue when the game expects you to jump and then has enemies flying down at you that are unavoidable. This is the only let down in what is a vitally important component.  Game play consists of constantly moving around the bottom of the screen while shooting ‚Äì automatically ‚Äì at enemies above and avoiding traps that are next to you constantly trying to kill you. The amount of power ups and their variety is one of the game‚Äôs key strengths.

Suitable for all ages: As the original title was intended for a younger audience the game is definitely accessible to younger players if you don‚Äôt mind them blasting space ships out of the sky. Although I do not have any children of my own I do feel that I am very education conscious. There is nothing here stopping children from playing the game. In fact, some of the video games that I played in my early education in school would have been much more of a concern than this. It‚Äôs animated violence and children would see much more violent things in their cartoons.

Good humor: What I loved perhaps most of all in Glorkian Warrior was the use of comedy. Again, it is something that all ages and audiences can appreciate but adults should not find too young. There‚Äôs a lot to like in the way that the story is told that will engage older gamers. It is good humor that will have you laughing when you‚Äôre not too busy concentrating on advancing further into the game.

Super Addictive: Glorkian Warrior is the very definition of a ‚Äòone more turn‚Äô game for me. This is accomplished through the superb unlock system in the game.  Every time you unlock something the next unlock feels as though its only a game or two away until you advance deep into the mid and latter parts of the game and only then does it begin to take considerable effort to get to the next unlock. Of course, by then, Pixeljam hope that you have improved sufficiently that the next unlock still doesn‚Äôt feel that far away. Unlocks include new power ups, birthday cakes, basketballs, ceramic cats ‚Äì that the developer owns ‚Äì and actual short comics that are a pleasure to read.

I thoroughly enjoyed Glorkian Warrior ‚Äì Trial of the Glork. It‚Äôs a perfectly addictive retro-style shoot‚Äôem up cross platformer that will keep you playing. I would recommend it to everyone and in my opinion is Pixeljam‚Äôs best game to date.

For similar reviews and our daily giveaways please visit http://www.steamified.com/

reviewText:
Pixeljam turns into chef-d'oeuvre whatever genre they are having a go at.
This is no exception : here is the Galaga clone to end all Galaga clones!
It features awesome art, incredible sound design, a cheery and absurd atmosphere, and even great characters!

The gameplay is as tight as in old coin-op shooters, and even if you aren't highscore chasing (which you should), there is plenty of wacky unlocks to pursue. Every second you play go toward that progress, which is always a nice touch of appreciation to the player from the designer.
I played to no end the phone version. This PC port retains the same very tight control scheme (you are autofiring and only controlling movements) that feels perfectly at home here too. The only thing missing are friends or even global leaderboards, but that's okay 'cause I don't have friends and I am bad at games.
[Edit : actually there are leaderboards, but I fail to see them sometimes @_@]

Wonderful.

reviewText:
It's passable, and while it's not for the hardcore shoot em up fan, there's reasonable variety and some fun.
There's good progression, and reasonable weapons, but there's nothing that stands out in any way. It's got a weird sense of humor and some great visuals, and bosses are a good mix up. If you're really hurting for a shoot em up,  consider getting it, or on IOS/Android if visuals arent' as important.

reviewText:
This game was reviewed using a code sent by the developer.
Glorkian Warrior is reminds me slightly of alien invaders. You are in control of the alien Glork, and you are protecting your asteroid from invading aliens. The game play is simple. Run around and shoot the aliens. You find that you are shooting constantly and bare no control over that, all you have to do is move around the level avoiding the rockets, rocks or whatever else the aliens shoot at you.

There is a nice unlock system where if you complete certain challenges or hit point barriers, you unlock different weapons. The different weapons can be picked up in game. These weapons can then be upgraded with various different effects, such as twisty lasers, rapid fire, or extra damage, some times you if you mix the right weapon with the right laser, you get a seriously over powered load out and just rip through everything.

I really like the cute sound effects on show here,  the voices sound hilarious, and I love the characters Chloe, and Chloe. I loved the back and forth between the characters.

On a whole, while this isn't the sort of game that will have you sitting down for hours upon hours a session, it does offer something different, short bursts of fun which is sometimes all you need just to relax and take your mind off life.

Would certainly recommend Glorkian Warrior!

Find more reviews at - http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

reviewText:
Do you like shooting weird looking creatures? Maybe ones that look like fallopian tubes with eyeballs? Or Brak and Zorak heads? Trust me you do want to shoot those things, they are cute but horrifying.

Then Glorkian Warrior: The Trial of Glork is for you!

Glorkian Warrior: The Trails of Glork is a Galaga inspired shooter brought to you by PixelJam. With a delightful art style by James Kochalka.

You play as Glork and must...save an asteroid for some reason. Who cares? You're constantly shooting up and with its own unique gameplay, powerups, unlockables, and ability to jump it sets it self apart from other similar games.

Whenever you get a new weapon there is what sounds like a bunch of children yelling out what you picked up. It's adorable - DOUBLE LASER!

The game is full of smiles from the nostalgia of shooters from my youth to the cute and funny cut scenes when you die I enjoyed every minute with Glorkian Warrior.

Currently only $3.99 on steam and it's totally worth it. I mean hell there's a 'Flarf' gun...What's a flarf gun? I have no idea. It shoots cotton balls? I don't know but it was great.

Checkout some gameplay here (May Still Be Uploading)

https://youtu.be/6vk19--u0qo

For more reviews and a bi-weekly podcast all about Early Access and Indie games check out www.EarlyAccessPodcast.com

reviewText:
A fun little Galaga-inspired arcade game.
Definitely containing stylistic inspirations of the classic Galaga arcade game, this was an enjoyable arcade game with many levels, aliens, and bonuses.  The aliens fly out in Galaga-esque flight patterns, taking place in the sky with a playing field that spans approx 2 screens wide making it somewhat unique.

Blowing up aliens quickly earns you more perks -- double lasers, fireballs, glorf gun, and such -- and also causes the aliens to drop crackers" which you collect.  Crackers advance you to the next bonus's such as different graphics or enabling new perks that can drop that help you shoot more aliens.

While there is no 'end' to the game
date: I thoroughly enjoyed my 3.1 hours to unlock the last perk.  One unique thing that makes this different than a usual arcade game where you start over from the same beginning every time
recommended: this behaves more like where each game is a "Continue" of the previous game

reviewText:
This game has some originality - that is, instead of being a 2D retro pixel shooter, it's a 2D retro art class dropout shooter.

Game runs in windowed mode without any applicable graphics settings whatsoever, but that's fine, I wouldn't like to see it enlarged enough to fit my screen anyway.

Gameplay is a ripoff of Galaga.   Art style is high school level.

This looks and feels like someones C graded product from a computer game design class.   Obviously not worth buying.

reviewText: The Trials of Glork is a goofy little game that doesn't take itself at all seriously.  Underneath the goofy exterior, though, is a solidly done Galaxian clone of sorts with platformer controls.\n\nThe game is limited.  There's not a whole lot of depth here, and it probably won't hold your attention all that long.  But it's a budget title; it's entirely worthy of the few dollars it's asking.

reviewText:
This is a fantastic Galaga style game with the art style and humor of James Kochalka, of American Elf fame. Galaga has been my favorite game since an Atari controller hit my hand in 1988, and I've gotta say- 'Glorkian Warrior' is the only game since then in the genre that I've had nearly as much fun with. This game is *that good*.

It's been years since a game made me WANT to get better at it (and I have, I actually have the #2 score on the Ace difficulty leaderboard right now, though I'm sure that will change).

Negatives: Pretty shallow menu, to view global leaderboards it has to launch an external window. It's a bit unclear what causes the different events and levels, every game can feel vastly different than the last (which is also a positive, it would just be nice to know why/when some of the things happen)

HIGHLY recommended. Here's some gameplay https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-Az6bic8ts

reviewText: Neverending randomized Galaga designed by James Kochalka Superstar that does the shooting for you. Good job.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Fun and colorful little arcade game. If you're looking for something quick and simple to play in 10 minute spurts, this might be for you. As you play the game you collect credits which unlock different powerups and gameplay elements. The enemies and bosses are randomized, so every game is a little bit different, which keeps it from getting old too fast. There isn't a ton of content in this game as there is only one game mode. It would have been nice to see a couple gameplay variations. I suggest getting it while it's on sale.

reviewText:
ITS YOUR TYPICAL PLATFORM SHOOTER THAT CHANGES EVERYTIME YOU PLAY.

There's no such thing as the same in this shooter. The different achievements unlock variables of the game that gives it its freshness! Each game is different since you never know what the RNGods will give you; may it be raining basketballs that explode or tennis balls as bullets! There's spontaneity in this one folks!

Its definitely family friendly for all ages and the retro music sends you reminiscing of past video games! Music is great and its dorky cartoony visuals are something to look forward to!

I give it a 8/10 for its excellence as a game of its genre

Check out my silly video of the game as well!
https://youtu.be/Y0NMhlZvsUo

reviewText:
SCIENCE IS MAGIC!
Glorkian Warrior = Galaga + Buster Bros + Neon Radioactive Splorchium

No, there is no real Neon Radioactive Splorchium, but it conveys the type of sensibility this game has.  That retro, goofy sci-fi of Spaceman Spiff, Commander Keen, and Buck Rodgers kinda schtick.  It's silly and cute and if those two words just made you throw up a little, then this ain't the game for you.

As to the gameplay, it most closely resembles Galaga or Space Invaders.  Enemies fly out in patterns and attempt to shoot you and/or fly into you.  The formula is broken up a bit by little blobs known as Spitters" coming along the ground from off-screen requiring you to jump on or over them.  Also
date: the odd meteor/Tetris piece shower happens and the meteors can be broken into smaller pieces by shooting them
recommended: which felt somewhat like it was inspired by the Buster Bros/Pang series of games.\n\nAs you play you collect crackers.  Yes.  Crackers.  Which are apparently the choice intergalactic currency.  Crackers will slightly refill your power-up meter and will also serve to unlock additional weapons
voteText: enemies
helpfulPercent: and other assorted goodies as you play
votesTotal: and play again.  This adds to the replay value of an otherwise pretty simple and straightforward game.  The controls are pretty tight and definitely don't work against you.  Firing your weapon is automatic and saves you from the pain of thumb-blisters.\n\nThere is a decent variety of weapons
votesFunny: some standard (such as a triple laser) and some goofy (such as tennis balls) but only half of them really stand out as especially useful - though anything is better than the default pea-shooter.  There are also two secondary power-ups
commentsCount: rapid fire and power.  The first being self-explanatory and the second simply adding more damage and increasing projectile size.  Having both power-ups active at once makes every weapon ten times better
column16: even the default.  All weapons and power-ups are time-limited
column17: with the exception that weapons can have their time extended by collecting crackers.\n\nDespite the kid-friendly graphics and humor
column18: the game can be rather hard and unfair
column19: sometimes just literally carpet bombing you with an impossible to dodge barrage of enemies and projectiles.  Often the jumping aspect becomes an annoyance because you bonk your head into the flurry of enemies.  You can often die because when it gets hectic it becomes very hard to discern between what is a cracker
column22: or one of the enemies.  Particularly when enemy projectiles often have the same colors as yours.  It also doesn't offer much in the way of long term replay value.  It nails the basics well enough
column24:
that it's one of those games you can come back to every so often to enjoyable kill some time.

reviewText: Possibly the best retro shooter on Steam. Controls like a dream. Plenty of variation for the dollar and a legitimate challenge. With the fun art and design, it's a steal for the price point.

reviewText: This game is beyond fantastic!  Charm for Days!  The Gameplay is spot on, the art style is unique and beautiful, and the dialog in the speech bubbles is outright hilarious!  And the sound effects?  So cool!  I remember the Arcade days during the 80s, new attract sounds coming out of amazing machines, drawing me to deposit my quarters.  Glorkian Warrior absolutely nails that feeling and takes me back!\n\nGet this amazing game!

reviewText: Awesome Space Invaders/Galaga/etc. clone. Simple but functional graphics, funny dialogue, catchy chiptune music.\nIf only if had higher and more stable framerate. From time to time I die due to laggy controls, but still can't stop playing.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: This can be a fun game but that fun will wear off after a little bit. It's a shmup in the style of space invaders. I unlocked all the little changes it adds to the game but it really never made much of a difference.  I don't feel any need to continue any more with the game. Many of the remaining achievements are insane and would require a lot of hours playing which I just can't do.\n\nIt might be worth picking up on a sale for under a dollar but nothing more. Other than that I just can't recommend it.
